./

tricenter.pro


NAME: TRICENTER

PURPOSE: Finds the center of 3 suns in a single image. Currently limited to a .bmp test image.

Author information

Author

JEREN SUZUKI:

Space Sciences Laboratory 7 Gauss Way Berkeley, CA 94720 USA E-mail: jsuzuki@ssl.berkeley.edu

Routines

minicrop, temparr, rowscan, colscan, rowendscan, colendscan [, scan_width=scan_width] [, sundiam=sundiam] [, thresh=thresh] [, time=time]

Small function to keep code small in cropit.

result = cropit(location, region=region, inputarr=inputarr [, scan_width=integer], sundiam=sundiam [, sigmavalue=integer] [, time=time])

Loads a triple-sun image and crops out selected regions one-by-one.

result = tribox(region=region [, file=string] [, time=time] [, scan_width=integer] [, sigmavalue=integer])

The triple-sun variant of scanbox(), the goal of this is to provide cropped regions for each centering method to compute the centers of.

trimask, xpos, ypos, thresh [, file=string] [, time=time] [, sigmavalue=integer], region=integer

Had to make a new version of comp3 because the old one called scanbox() by default

getstruct, struct [, scan_width= integer] [, file= string] [, sigmavalue= integer] [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

tricenter [, file=string] [, scan_width=byte] [, time=time] [, sigmavalue=sigmavalue]

Finds the pitch and yaw of a triple sun image.

Routine details

top source minicrop

minicrop, temparr, rowscan, colscan, rowendscan, colendscan [, scan_width=scan_width] [, sundiam=sundiam] [, thresh=thresh] [, time=time]

Small function to keep code small in cropit. Finds the row where the threshold is crossed and then steps back in the x-direction to find the left side of the cropping box. Skips over the sun by a predetermined value then crops out the sun.

Parameters

temparr
rowscan
colscan
rowendscan
colendscan

Keywords

scan_width in optional default= 5

Distance between scan lines when looking for first instance of threshold crossing

sundiam in optional default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

thresh in optional default= max(array) - sigmavalue*stddev(array)

Threshold used for masking

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

top source cropit

result = cropit(location, region=region, inputarr=inputarr [, scan_width=integer], sundiam=sundiam [, sigmavalue=integer] [, time=time])

Loads a triple-sun image and crops out selected regions one-by-one.

Parameters

location

Keywords

region
inputarr
scan_width in optional type=integer default=5

How far apart the scanning should be.

sundiam
sigmavalue in optional type=integer default=1

Sets the threshold to be:

max(image) - sigmavalue*stddev(image)

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

Examples

cropped = cropit(region=1,inputarr=image,sundiam=sundiam,scan_width=scan_width,thresh=thresh)

top source tribox

result = tribox(region=region [, file=string] [, time=time] [, scan_width=integer] [, sigmavalue=integer])

The triple-sun variant of scanbox(), the goal of this is to provide cropped regions for each centering method to compute the centers of.

Keywords

region
file in optional type=string default=triplesun.bmp

File to be read in

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

scan_width in optional type=integer default=5

How far apart the scanning should be. Fine tuned compared to scanbox

sigmavalue in optional type=integer default=2

Sets the threshold to be:

max(image) - sigmavalue*stddev(image)

Examples

cropped = scanbox(file='triplesun.bmp',/time)

top source trimask

trimask, xpos, ypos, thresh [, file=string] [, time=time] [, sigmavalue=integer], region=integer

Had to make a new version of comp3 because the old one called scanbox() by default

Parameters

xpos
ypos
thresh

Keywords

file in optional type=string

What file to load in

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

sigmavalue in optional type=integer default=2

Sets the threshold to be:

max(image) - sigmavalue*stddev(image)

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

top source getstruct

getstruct, struct [, scan_width= integer] [, file= string] [, sigmavalue= integer] [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

Parameters

struct

Keywords

scan_width in optional type= integer default= 5

How apart the scans are for minicrop(). Overrides defaults in tribox().

file in optional type= string default= 'triplesun.bmp'

What file to find 4 centers for

sigmavalue in optional type= integer default= 2

Sets the threshold to be:

max(image) - sigmavalue*stddev(image)

time in optional

Outputs how much time the program takes

top source tricenter

tricenter [, file=string] [, scan_width=byte] [, time=time] [, sigmavalue=sigmavalue]

Finds the pitch and yaw of a triple sun image. What those are I don't know, but will that affect my code writing ability?? Probably not.

Important!: IDL uses the origin to be the top left corner for 2d arrays and a column is indexed from 0 starting from the top. You have been WARNED.

Keywords

file in optional type=string default=triplesun.bmp

File to be read in

scan_width in optional type=byte default= 10

How far apart the scans are

time in optional

Outputs how much time the program takes

sigmavalue in optional default=2

Sets the threshold to be:

max(image) - sigmavalue*stddev(image)
